ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Return a plot, contour, or image of a model, or the associated preferences

LIST.ITEM: id - the id of the dataset to use; if not given, uses the default dataset id (id=1 by default, see "ahelp get_default_id")

DESC.PARA: The get_model_plot command returns a model plot object which holds references to various plot preferences and data arrays. The attributes are:

ROW.DATA: The value of the dependent variable
The label for the X axis
The label for the Y axis

DESC.PARA: Note that the show_model command ("ahelp show_model") is recommended to simply print the current model to the screen.
The get_model_plot_prefs command returns a dictionary of model plot preferences. For example:

Users can change preferences as desired in the set returned by this function, as shown below in the examples. These preferences changes the appearance of models plotted using the following commands: plot_model(), plot_bkg_model(), the "fit" versions of these commands, such as plot_fit(), plot_bkg_fit(), and plot_fit_delchi().
The get_model_contour command returns a model contour object which holds references to various plot preferences and data arrays. The attributes are:

ROW.DATA: The coordinate values for the first axis as a 1D array
The coordinate values for the second axis as a 1D array
The model value at each point of (x0,x1) as a 1D array
The levels used for drawing contours
The label for the X axis
The label for the Y axis

The get_model_image command returns an image object which holds the reference to the image array. The attributes are:

ROW.DATA: Information on the world coordinate system (if available)
Information on the physical coordinate system (if available)

DESC.PARA: Change the defaults for plot_model() so that:

LIST.ITEM: both the X and Y axes will be drawn using a log scale;
the points will be connected using a dotted, orange line of thickness 2.

DESC.PARA: Return a model plot object for the default dataset.
Return a model contour object for dataset "src".
